conclusion: Need to analyze the velocity-time graphs of both particles to determine the ratio of magnitudes of acceleration.
Particle A accelerates from rest to a maximum velocity of 2v0 in the first 2t0 seconds.
Particle B accelerates from rest to a maximum velocity of v0 in the first t0 seconds.
Acceleration a_A is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph in the first 2t0 seconds, calculated as 2v0 / 2t0 = v0 / t0.
Acceleration a_B is given by the slope of the velocity-time graph in the first t0 seconds, calculated as v0 / t0.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for A and B during their acceleration phases is calculated as a_A/a_B = (v0 / t0) / (v0 / t0) = 1.
The ratio of the magnitudes of acceleration for particles A and B during their acceleration phases is 1:1.
